titleStmt.title: M. Van Royally, Rules and regulations of the Pigeon hole Table
CWG1226

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p: Rules and regulations of the Pigeon hole Table
1st No Minors are allowed to play on this Table
2nd No betting allowed in the room or any other part of the house on any proposition

5th Sweepstakes game of 300 for each person playing 10cts or at the option of the partied playing each may buy 15cts worth of refreshments or a ticket calling for same and play without charge a game of 300 Games for higher number than 300 will be charged in proportion
6th For every game of eight balls five cents for each person playing which must be spent for refreshements
7th Gambling of all sorts including betting drinks or treats of all kinds is positively prohibited

8th Bystanders will be please ^refrain^ from making from making remarks about the game either advising how to play or correcting mistakes made in the unless called on to do so by the parties engaged in playing
9th The price charged for playing must be paid as soon as the game is over as there will be no accounts kept
